creator: carnold@houston.rr.com
text:
The description on the eventType parameter to the DocumentEvent.createEvent in 
section 1.5 of DOM 2 Events says (http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-
Events/events.html#Events-DocumentEvent-createEvent):

... a user wishing to synthesize some kind of UIEvent would call createEvent 
with the parameter "UIEvents"

Basically, the eventType argument appears to follow the feature name for the 
hasFeature() call and not the interface name.  The same instruction is repeated 
in section 1.6.

The current Xerces-J CVS (and most probably all previous version) only 
recognize "Event" and "MutationEvent" values with are not mentioned in the spec.

There are a couple of approaches:

1. Change "Event" and "MutationEvent" in DocumentImpl.createEvent to "Events" 
and "MutationEvents".  This would bring behavior into at least minimal 
conformance with the spec, but may break existing apps that depend on the 
behavior.

2. Accept both "Event" and "Events" or "MutationEvent" and "MutationEvents".  
This would conform and support existing apps, but may encourage non-portable 
use.

3. Compare "Events" and "MutationEvents" case-insensitive.  The spec does draw 
the parallel with features which are case-insensitive.

4. Case insensitive with or without the "s"
Thank you for reporting this problem. It is fixed in CVS [see approach 2].
